relevant_findings.neurological: The patient appeared well and was no longer confused; she was alert, attentive, and oriented to person, place, and time.
relevant_findings.cardiac: Regular rate, without any murmurs or extra heart sounds; jugular venous pressure was 6 cm of water; no carotid bruits were detected.
relevant_findings.neurological_exam: Normal strength and sensation; symmetric reflexes; no evidence of clonus, fasciculations, or ataxia; intact short-term and long-term memory.

vital_signs.blood_glucose: 40 mg per deciliter (2.2 mmol per liter)

relevant_findings.neurological: Patient witnessed with a blank stare and not responding; after falling, she was minimally responsive.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms were episodic, with confusion, dizziness, and transient diplopia reported prior to this event.
